title: Optimal Control Design Based on Reinforcement Learning for Nonlinear Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: A Process for Practicing Optimal Control Strategies of Nonlinear Systems via Reinforcement Learning Simulations in Smartphone-Centric Limited Environments, with Case-Based Learning Considering Workplace Applicability for Employees

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the characteristics of nonlinear dynamical systems and explain extremum-seeking-based control principles.
Learners can implement optimal control policies for unknown systems using reinforcement learning algorithms.
Learners can apply control strategies to real-world social issues (e.g., energy management optimization) using smartphone-based simulation tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
